title: Lucy Liu stuns in red frock with frilly layered bodice at Hudson River Park Gala in NYC
text:
She's a native of Queens, New York.

And on Thursday, Lucy Liu lent her star power to an annual fundraiser for Hudson River Park.

The actress, 50, opted for a bold red dress for her night out which she paired with yellow strappy heels.

For a good cause: She's a native of Queens, New York. And on Thursday, Lucy Liu lent her star power to an annual fundraiser for Hudson River Park

The star of TV's Elementary wore her bobbed hair sleekly styled and accessorized with diamond earrings.

Her dress featured a layered frilly bodice and was cinched at the waist with a narrow belt.

Liu kept her makeup light with just a touch of mascara, a hint of blush and matte lip color.

Eye-catching: The actress, 50, opted for a bold red dress for her night out which she paired with yellow strappy heels

Stylish: Her dress featured a layered frilly bodice and was cinched at the waist with a narrow belt

The former Ally McBeal star was one of the honorees at the gala.

Also being honored was former NY mayor and philanthropist Michael Bloomberg and chef David Chang, founder of Momofuku.

The evening event was hosted by actress and comedienne Sandra Bernhard.

Celebrities on hand included Martha Stewart, Bachelorette star Tyler Cameron and Aidan Quinn.

Coordinated ensemble: Martha Stewart, 78, supported the fundraiser wearing a cream top and gold trousers with a yellow knit cardigan and sandal heels

Looking good: Actress and comedienne Sandra Bernhard, 64, hosted the evening gala. She wore a tri-color checkered dress with long sleeves and added black pumps

Dapper: Bachelorette star Tyler Cameron, 26, opted for a dark two-piece suit with open-neck white shirt and black loafers

Feted: Former NY mayor and philanthropist Michael Bloomberg, 77, was one of the honorees

Big night: Another honoree was chef David Yang, founder of Momofuku. The 42-year-old restaurateur was accompanied to the event by his wife Grace

Entertained the crowd: Bernhard emcee'd the evening held at Cipriani South Street that raised money for the trust that oversees the park along the Hudson River on the westside
